0.text:
Translator: Monica Ronchi
Reviewer: Denise RQ

11.text:
I am going to share with you all
my story of Sisu and not being perfect.

21.text: I was at mile 75 of a 100-mile race.

29.text:
I was knee-deep in snow,
and I was almost hypothermic.

33.text:
I'd really needed to eat and drink,
but I kept throwing everything up.

37.text:
Darcy, the defending champ,
had just flown by me.

41.text:
I was in the worse place
I've ever been in a race before.

46.text:
My crew, who had more food,
more drink, and more warm clothes

49.text: were another five hours of running away

52.text:
and then, the finish was
another five hours from there,

58.text:
I needed to sleep more
than I've ever needed to sleep before

62.text:
but stopping there,
in the snow-capped mountains

64.text: would have meant death or close to it.

67.text:
I moved slowly, step by step,
through the snow

69.text:
and I could feel every single step
like a dagger in my thighs.

73.text:
My pacer, a safety runner, gave me
all his love, patience, and forward energy

79.text:
and eventually after a really long, slow,
and extremely painful downhill,

84.text: we got into the aid station.

87.text: I lay in the frozen grass.

89.text: All I wanted was a three-minute sleep.

92.text:
But my crew had their warm hands
all over me rubbing my legs awake,

98.text:
and handing me warm soup
and coke to drink.

101.text:
After ten minutes, I realized
I wasn't going to get any sleep,

105.text:
so took my peanut butter and jam sandwich,
stood up, and walked slowly out of there,

110.text:
looking back at their faces,
of emotion filled with willing and pain,

114.text:
as I went back
into the cold mountains again.

118.text:
I was in total oblivion –
just marching to my breath.

125.text:
It was still really dark,
and freezing cold.

128.text:
But now I could hear
the chirp of the birds,

130.text:
and the rustle of the little chipmunks
all around me.

134.text: I stopped for a bite of my sandwich

135.text:
and threw a few crusts
to the little animals,

137.text: who were living so freely and happily

139.text:
in a place that was just
so dark for me at that time.

143.text:
And then, up ahead,
we could see Darcy's light

146.text:
shining really brightly
on the cliffs ahead.

151.text: The impossible was about to happen.

155.text:
all the strength, resilience,
and determination I had,

159.text: looked the mountains in the face,

161.text:
pushed through the deep physical pain
and mental fatigue, and went.

166.text:
It was now or never,
my pacer and I agreed.

171.text:
This had been my dream for three years,
and I wasn't ready to let that go.

176.text:
The moment when the sun
touched my skin, warming me,

180.text:
I now understood the words
of love and encouragement

183.text:
that my other pacer had told me
in the aid station before.

186.text: The Sun would be up soon.

191.text:
I went somewhere I had just
never been before.

199.text:
I ate all the caffeine gels
that I had in my bag, and we went.

202.text: We didn't stop, we didn't talk,

204.text:
we just charged silently
and respectfully past Darcy,

208.text: and into the next aid station

210.text:
where my crew
weren't expecting me just yet.

213.text:
There was a major commotion
as I tore off through the final 15 miles.

217.text:
I had just a fiery focus on the trails
and, of course, on the markers ahead.

221.text: I wasn't going to get lost at that point.

224.text:
We didn't stop, we didn't talk,
we just charged,

227.text:
and my breath was all I had
to breathe out that pain

231.text: in my legs with every step.

234.text:
He had soothing words,
ignored my grunts of agony,

238.text:
ignored the crazy words of hallucination,
and just kept me going.

243.text: It was then 2.3 miles to go.

246.text: We were now 30 minutes ahead of Darcy,

249.text:
I didn't want her to catch us,
so we kept charging until we got there.

254.text:
And as we approached the finish,
I had tears in my eyes.

258.text: Not only had I just finished the race,

260.text: but I was about to win Hardrock 100,

263.text:
one of the hardest 100-mile races
in the world,

267.text:
One where you climb the equivalent height
of Mount Everest twice.

274.text:
My parents were there
to share the moment with me.

277.text: My crew who had believed in me,

279.text: understood and knew what I was capable of.

283.text: and so pushed me a little touch more.

287.text:
It was one of the moments
when I felt most empowered as a woman,

295.text: Sisu is a Finnish word and way of life.

298.text:
It is "the extraordinary courage
and determination

304.text:
Sisu has encompassed
everything in my life.

309.text:
It is the people, the journey,
the experiences, it's a frame of mind.

314.text:
It's a strength and determination
that nothing is impossible,

317.text:
and it's the heart of what I draw on
in moments like Hardrock.

323.text:
My life has been
a journey of stubbornness.

325.text:
It often got me in trouble,
at school especially.

328.text:
But more times than not,
through pure determination,

332.text:
and I think, most importantly,
with no fear of falling,

336.text:
I've forced my way through closed doors,
and found what I've been searching for:

340.text:
the love and joy of being
an empowered woman

343.text: with a whole world full of opportunities.

346.text: I was continually learning about Sisu.

351.text:
I want there to be
more Sisu girls in our world.

357.text: Girls who are confident and not dependent

360.text:
on being attractive to,
or approved of, by anyone else.

365.text:
Girls who go on to get more
out of the world.

368.text:
I want a world of girls who stand up
for what they believe in.

371.text:
Girls who are brave enough
to sit outside of their comfort zone.

375.text:
I want all of us
to raise our girls with fierce Sisu.

382.text:
Do you all encourage your children
to spread their wings,

385.text: fly, and then fall flat on their face?

389.text: We need to show our children resilience.

391.text:
We need to show our children
that falling is not failing,

397.text:
but it is about how we get up
from that fall, learn from it,

405.text:
and see that perfection
is not how life is.

412.text:
Running is about the most honest
I have to be with myself.

417.text: It is a simple and empowering activity.

420.text:
All we need is our shoes,
determination, and breath.

424.text: It still surprises me what we can achieve

427.text: with our own two feet and a lot of Sisu.

431.text: And even when times do get tough,

434.text:
we do have control
of how we deal with things.

437.text:
Even in these high and quiet mountains,
when there is no way out,

441.text:
you need to find your tenacity
to hold on through the pain and fatigue;

445.text: you need to find your inner Sisu.

448.text: And you can't just expect to have it.

450.text:
You have to earn it, learn it,
and be nurtured through it.

456.text: My footsteps have not always been easy.

458.text:
There have been struggles,
like politics in sport, injuries,

463.text:
relationship battles, constant movement
with no structure or routine.

470.text:
I was standing on the podium
with two other women.

473.text:
We had been given nice bathrobes,
and some suntan lotion as our prize.

477.text:
The men got 1,500 euros
and a case of beer each.

483.text:
Being Sisu girls enabled us
to stand our ground against inequality

487.text: in a sport that we love.

490.text:
We didn't move from that podium
until the organizers agreed to acknowledge

497.text:
that we had done something
just as awesome as men.

500.text:
And we demanded equal prizes
for men and women.

503.text: It is through struggles like these

506.text:
that I have learned what a girl
with Sisu looks like:

515.text: a girl who has fallen time and time again,

518.text:
and is not afraid
to fall gracefully again.

522.text:
I am honored to be considered
a Sisu girl - as a positive role model

527.text:
to encourage others, especially girls,
to find their inner Sisu,

533.text:
to show the world their true colors,
their determination to succeed

537.text:
through trial and error, strength
and fun, hard work and passion.

542.text:
People often ask me,
"How can I teach Sisu to my children?"

546.text: I answer, "You can't do it alone."

552.text: It's not simple, we need all hands on.

555.text:
We need to nurture and nourish everyone
for what they are and who they are.

560.text:
We need to encourage them,
as my parents did for me,

564.text:
as wonderful role models,
to spread their wings and fly.

569.text:
All of you, each and every one of you,
also have the opportunity

573.text:
to be wonderful role models
to the girls and boys in your lives.

578.text:
Together, let's make a change
and celebrate what we have,

583.text:
which is an opportunity
for a world full of Sisu girls.
